Abstract: This study examines recent technological advancements in language documentation, focusing on innovative methods for resource creation and mobilization. The integration of digital tools, such as audio and video recording software, 3D scanning, and virtual reality platforms, has significantly enhanced the documentation process. Additionally, the development of open-source software and online platforms has facilitated collaboration and data sharing among linguists and communities. The abstract highlights the potential of these technologies to democratize language documentation, increase accessibility, and promote linguistic diversity. By exploring the intersection of technology and language documentation, this study aims to contribute to the development of more effective and sustainable language preservation strategies.
